title: Comparison of Instructional Design Models and Their Application in Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental mathematical concepts, experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Comparative analysis course for strengthening mathematical instructional competencies for working professionals, considering smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can compare and explain the key stages of the Dick & Carey model and the Morrison-Ross-Kemp model
Learners can analyze differences between the two models and select appropriate approaches for mathematics instructional design
Through project-based assessment methods, learners can propose model application strategies for actual mathematics lesson design

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
